ovdesc.p: The purpose of this table is to define the tax payable for stamp tax, cantonal tax and EBV fees, when securities are traded within T24.

desc.p: Defines the "Tax Code" of the record in the Tax table which will be used to calculate the tax payable.

When the combination of events specified in the previous fields occurs (e.g. New Issue of Local Bonds) T24 will use the value contained in this field to read the tax table and thus calculate the appropriate amount of tax.
1 to 2 Numeric Characters (Mandatory input)
Must be a valid Tax Code in the Tax table.
This is a multi valued field. Standard T24 alphanumeric field.
A maximum of 30 characters may be entered.
Fields LOCAL.FOREIGN to CREDIT.DEBIT form a related multi value set.
A maximum of 8 characters may be entered.
The following values are permitted: BROKER CUSTOMER
Fields LOCAL.FOREIGN to CREDIT.DEBIT form a related multi value set.
A maximum of 6 characters may be entered.
The following values are permitted: CREDIT DEBIT
Defines the event upon which Tax will be levied.
1 to 20 Alphanumeric Characters (Mandatory input)
Only the values TRADE, NEW.ISSUE and TRANSFER can be entered in this field.
Defines whether tax is to be levied on Local Securities, Foreign Securities or both.
1 to 20 Alphanumeric Characters (Mandatory input)
Only the Values: LOCAL FOREIGN BOTH can be entered in this field.
Allows definition of stamp tax applicability and rates by security domicile
Must be a valid Country Code which exists on the Country Code Table
Allows definition of stamp tax rules by exchange
Must exist in the STOCK.EXCHANGE file
Allows definition of stamp tax at an individual security level
Validation Rules
Must exist in the SECURITY.MASTER file
Identifies the type of ASSET or SUB.ASSET.TYPE on which stamp duty is applicable
Validation Rules
Must exist in the ASSET or SUB.ASSET.TYPE file
E.G, For ASSET type it should be A-30 and for SUB.ASSET.TYPE, it should be S-301
